alert.note: Alert for Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:46PM EDT until August 05 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEASTERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND WEST CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES COUNTY... At 546 PM EDT, the public reported that flooding is ongoing in parts of eastern and southeastern DC. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Coral Hills... Bladensburg... RFK Stadium... Gallaudet University... Fort Totten... Nationals Park... Howard University... Landover... Hyattsville... East Riverdale... Walker Mill... Riverdale Park... Cheverly... Seat Pleasant... Kenilworth... Anacostia... US Capitol... Greater Landover... Carmody Hills-Pepper Mill Village...Chillum... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
